intro: Strychnos trichocalyx, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces orange-red berries that are edible when ripe but contain toxic compounds. Its botanical features include woody stems, opposite leaf arrangement, and distinctive floral morphology. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and traditional uses in some regions.
